validation_items.question: Are all domain microservices accessible via domain APIs?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: All domain microservices expose domain APIs documented in integration catalog
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Microservices exist without domain API exposure

validation_items.question: Is API catalog complete with endpoints, authentication, SLAs?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Complete API catalog with endpoints, methods, authentication documented
validation_rules.fail_criteria: API catalog missing or incomplete

validation_items.question: Do APIs follow RESTful design principles?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: APIs follow REST principles (resource-oriented, HTTP verbs, stateless, JSON)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Non-RESTful design or RPC-style endpoints

validation_items.question: Is API versioning strategy defined?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: API versioning strategy defined (URL path, header, or query parameter)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No versioning or breaking changes without version management

validation_items.question: Are APIs documented with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: APIs documented with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications
validation_rules.fail_criteria: APIs lack documentation or outdated documentation

validation_items.question: Is API authentication secure (OAuth 2.0, JWT, mTLS)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Secure authentication for all APIs
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Basic authentication, hardcoded credentials, or no authentication

validation_items.question: Is API authorization model defined (RBAC/ABAC)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Authorization model with fine-grained access control
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No authorization or all-or-nothing access

validation_items.question: Is TLS 1.2+ enforced for all integrations?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: TLS 1.2+ for all API communications
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Unencrypted communications or TLS 1.0/1.1

validation_items.question: Are API credentials stored in secure vault?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: API credentials stored in approved vault
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Credentials in code, configuration files, or environment variables

validation_items.question: Are REST APIs using HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2 (not HTTP/1.0)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: REST APIs use HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2, JSON format
validation_rules.fail_criteria: HTTP/1.0 or deprecated XML-RPC

validation_items.question: If using SOAP, is it SOAP 1.2 with migration plan?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: SOAP 1.2 with documented migration path to REST
validation_rules.fail_criteria: SOAP 1.0 or no migration plan

validation_items.question: Is message broker modern (Kafka, RabbitMQ, cloud-native)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Modern message broker with current version
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Deprecated broker (WebSphere MQ 7.x, MSMQ) or end-of-life version

validation_items.question: Is integration platform current or cloud-native (no legacy ESB)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Modern integration platform (MuleSoft, Azure Logic Apps, AWS Step Functions) or no ESB (cloud-native)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Legacy ESB (Oracle SOA Suite 11g, WebSphere ESB) without upgrade path

validation_items.question: Do APIs follow organizational naming conventions?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: APIs follow organizational naming conventions (resource naming, URI structure)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Inconsistent naming or non-standard URI patterns

validation_items.question: Is API lifecycle management defined (design to deprecation)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: API lifecycle stages defined (design, development, testing, production, deprecation)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No lifecycle management or uncontrolled API changes

validation_items.question: Do API changes follow governance process?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: API changes follow governance process (change request, impact analysis, stakeholder approval)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Uncontrolled API changes causing breaking changes

validation_items.question: Does architecture reference integration governance playbook?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Architecture references organizational integration governance playbook with compliance confirmation
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No playbook reference or non-compliance

validation_items.question: Is third-party API inventory complete?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Complete inventory of third-party APIs with vendor, purpose, endpoint, authentication
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Third-party APIs used without central catalog

validation_items.question: Do third-party APIs provide OpenAPI/Swagger specifications?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Third-party APIs provide OpenAPI/Swagger specification or equivalent documentation
validation_rules.fail_criteria: APIs lack formal specification

validation_items.question: Are third-party API SLAs documented?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: SLAs documented for third-party APIs (availability, response time, rate limits)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No SLA documentation or unknown service levels

validation_items.question: Are third-party vendor support contacts documented?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Support contacts documented for third-party vendors (email, portal, escalation path)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No support contact information

validation_items.question: Is distributed tracing implemented (OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, Zipkin)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Distributed tracing implemented across all integrations
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No distributed tracing or siloed tracing
validation_rules.na_criteria: Monolithic application with no distributed calls

validation_items.question: Is trace context propagated across service boundaries?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Trace context propagated (W3C Trace Context standard, correlation IDs in headers)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Trace context not propagated or broken trace chains

validation_items.question: Is structured logging implemented with JSON format?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Structured logging with standard format (JSON, key-value pairs, consistent schema)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Unstructured text logs or inconsistent formats

validation_items.question: Are logs sent to centralized logging platform?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Logs sent to centralized platform
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Logs stored locally or not centralized

validation_items.question: Are event schemas defined with standard format (JSON Schema/Avro)?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Event schemas defined with standard format
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Unstructured events or no schema validation

validation_items.question: Do events follow CloudEvents specification?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Events follow CloudEvents specification for metadata (id, source, type, time)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Custom event format without standard metadata

validation_items.question: Is event catalog documenting all events?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: Event catalog documenting all events (name, schema, producers, consumers, purpose)
validation_rules.fail_criteria: Events lack documentation or unknown producers/consumers

validation_items.question: Is Dead Letter Queue configured for failed events?

validation_rules.pass_criteria: DLQ configured for failed event processing with monitoring and retry policies
validation_rules.fail_criteria: No DLQ or unmonitored failures

8.0-10.0.message: High confidence validation. Contract automatically approved.

7.0-7.9.message: Validation passed with small gaps. Ready for human review.

5.0-6.9.message: Integration architecture incomplete. Address gaps before approval.
blockers: Must document all 7 LAI integration requirements in ARCHITECTURE.md Sections 5, 6, 7, 9
Must ensure domain APIs for all microservices (LAI1)
Must implement secure integrations with OAuth 2.0/mTLS and TLS 1.2+ (LAI2)
Must catalog third-party APIs with SLAs (LAI5)
Must implement distributed tracing and structured logging (LAI6)

0.0-4.9.message: Critical integration architecture failures. Cannot proceed.
blockers: LAI1 Best Practices: Missing domain APIs or API catalog
LAI2 Secure Integrations: Missing authentication/authorization or using basic auth
LAI3 Obsolete Technologies: Using deprecated integration technologies (SOAP 1.0, legacy ESB, WebSphere MQ)
LAI4 Governance: No API lifecycle management or change control
LAI6 Traceability: No distributed tracing or centralized logging

remediation_guidance.FAIL_items: Implement required integration architecture standards for all 7 LAI requirements or document approved exceptions with risk acceptance. Critical: domain API exposure (LAI1), secure authentication (LAI2), modern integration technologies (LAI3), governance compliance (LAI4), distributed tracing (LAI6)
remediation_guidance.UNKNOWN_items: Add missing integration architecture documentation to ARCHITECTURE.md Sections 5 (Component Model), 6 (Data Model), 7 (Integration View), and 9 (Security Architecture)
remediation_guidance.completeness_below_threshold: Complete all 7 LAI sections: Best Practices Adoption, Secure Integrations, No Obsolete Technologies, Integration Governance Standards, Third-Party Documentation, Traceability and Audit, and Event-Driven Integration Compliance
remediation_guidance.low_quality_score: Improve traceability by referencing specific ARCHITECTURE.md sections and line numbers for all integration architecture decisions across LAI1-LAI7 requirements
